children.subject: Yeah, I kinda forgot that c100 also covered some level of convexity.

history.content: I don't think any other set of courses could absolutely substitute data 100 because no other course teaches you pandas or data visualization. There aren't any other courses that uses pandas, as far as I know.

children.subject: Regarding pandas, it’s not actually a problem. I am feeling that R is more directive for visualization than pandas. The purpose for C100 to introduce pandas first is that pandas is more a neat package for visualization while R has more capacity for more complex tasks and complicated support for visualization.

history.content:
I know that Data C100 is a relatively light course in content (according to people took it, sometimes even like an actual LD in UDs), but it covers a broad sense of data science. Although any possible combination would be an absolute overkill for contents in data c100, it is still unclear to me that what combination of courses would absolutely substitute Data c100 (in other words, “rebuild a more advanced version with a few courses”). Are there any thoughts from people who have taken C100?

For example, regardless of several details, Data C100 covers some statistics, probably, and light version machine learning, then EE 126+CS 188 may be able to “rebuild” Data C100.

Another interpretation of this problem is, how can we find a track of course focusing on the data science life cycle. Since Data C100 is more like dealing with a light project/pipeline of data science, “including question formulation, data collection and cleaning, exploratory data analysis and visualization, statistical inference and prediction​, and decision-making”.

If there are anything wrong in my statements above, plz correct me.

Very appreciate!
history.subject: Course combinations that could absolutely substitute DataC100
